app.title: Happy Linux Cheatbook
app.subtitle: Elegant as Apple's blog, but with a flavor twist for Linux mastery
app.description: Transform commands into character stories, parameters into memorable flavors, and pipelines into layered desserts. Inspired by spec-workflow MCP planning, we turn every instruction into sticky notes that reconstruct your knowledge map in seconds.

commandRole.title: Commands = Characters
commandRole.detail: Assign each command a stage role (manager, detective, editor, curator). When you see the command, your mind plays the scene automatically.

parameterFlavor.title: Parameters = Flavor Profiles
parameterFlavor.detail: Flags are like different scoops: -a is ALL (almond), -h is human (hazelnut). Use taste associations to remember their purpose.

pipelineSundae.title: Pipelines = Layered Desserts
pipelineSundae.detail: Each step is a different layer: base sponge (ls), middle jam (grep), top cream (awk/tar). Combine them to tell the complete story.

alternativeIngredients.title: Alternatives = Substitute Ingredients
alternativeIngredients.detail: When scenarios change (performance / colored output / JSON), swap to eza, rg, jq and keep the same taste.

commandStories.title: Command Stories
commandStories.subtitle: From left-brain (history, function) to right-brain (metaphor, flavor), one card completes the memory hook.

pipelineLab.title: Pipeline Sundae Lab
pipelineLab.subtitle: Mix commands like making desserts: base layer chooses, middle filters, top presents.

systemConcepts.title: System Concepts
systemConcepts.subtitle: Understand system principles through theater operations: ticket system, layout map, show scheduling... dessert-level learning of Linux core concepts.
